com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.core
Class State

java.lang.Object
  com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.core.State

public class State
extends java.lang.Object

Denotes a state in a finite state machine. States are characterized by a state name, a state type, an optional parent state, and entry and exit actions. Sub-states are those states that have a parent state that encloses them.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Hodges

Constructor Detail

State

public State(java.lang.String name,
             StateType type,
             State parent,
             Action entryAction,
             Action exitAction)
Creates a new state.

Parameters:
name - A name that is unique within any state machine that contains this state
type - A state type as defined by StateType
parent - A parent state that contains this state if any
entryAction - An action to perform on entering the state
exitAction - An action to perform on leaving the state

State

public State(java.lang.Enum<?> stateEnum,
             StateType type,
             State parent,
             Action entryAction,
             Action exitAction)
Utility method that allows for an enumerated type to be passed in to define the name. This further allows for using enumerated types within classes that use the state machine.

Parameters:
stateEnum -
type -
parent -
entryAction -
exitAction -

getChildren

public java.util.List<State> getChildren()
Returns an immutable list of the children of this state. The list is empty if there are no children.
